intro: Hessea chaplinii, commonly known as the Cape Town daisies, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to coastal and mountainous regions. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers surrounded by white ray florets. Hessea chaplinii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and public spaces.
